source:
%%pyspark
csv_df = spark.read.load('abfss://files@datalakeaic4ypz.dfs.core.windows.net/sales_data_2021_Q1_February.csv', format='csv'
## If header exists uncomment line below
, header=True
)
csv_df.write.mode("overwrite").saveAsTable("default.YourTableName")

# Display schema and first few rows
csv_df.printSchema()
csv_df.show(10)

# Counting null values for each column
from pyspark.sql.functions import col, sum


null_counts = csv_df.select([sum(col(c).isNull().cast("int")).alias(c) for c in csv_df.columns])
null_counts.show()

# Counting total rows
total_rows = csv_df.count()

# Counting rows after dropping duplicates
distinct_rows = csv_df.dropDuplicates().count()

# Calculate no. of duplicate rows
duplicates_count = total_rows - distinct_rows
print(f"No. of duplicate rows: {duplicates_count}")

# Dropping rows with  null values
csv_df_cleaned = csv_df.dropna()

# Removing duplicate rows
csv_df_cleaned = csv_df_cleaned.dropDuplicates()

# Counting null values for each column after null value treatment
null_counts = csv_df_cleaned.select([sum(col(c).isNull().cast("int")).alias(c) for c in csv_df_cleaned.columns])
null_counts.show()

# Count total rows
total_rows = csv_df_cleaned.count()

# Count rows after dropping duplicates
distinct_rows = csv_df_cleaned.dropDuplicates().count()

# Calculate number of duplicate rows
duplicates_count = total_rows - distinct_rows
print(f"Number of duplicate rows: {duplicates_count}")

from pyspark.sql.functions import col

# Cast data types
csv_df_transformed = csv_df_cleaned.withColumn("quantity", col("quantity").cast("int")) \
                                    .withColumn("price", col("price").cast("double")) \
                                    .withColumn("total_amount", col("total_amount").cast("double"))
csv_df_transformed.printSchema()

from pyspark.sql.functions import to_date

# Convert sale_date from string to date
csv_df_transformed = csv_df.withColumn("sale_date", to_date(col("sale_date"), "yyyy-MM-dd"))

# Verify transformation
csv_df_transformed.printSchema()

from pyspark.sql.functions import sum

# Aggregate to find total sales amount by region
csv_sales_by_region = csv_df_transformed.groupBy("region").agg(sum("total_amount").alias("total_sales_amount"))

# Aggregate to find total quantity sold by product
csv_quantity_by_product = csv_df_transformed.groupBy("product_id", "product_name").agg(sum("quantity").alias("total_quantity_sold"))
display(csv_sales_by_region.limit(5))
display(csv_quantity_by_product.limit(5))
